location: Rome. A room in Marcius house.

lines.text: Enter VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIAthey set them down on two low stools, and sew

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: I pray you, daughter, sing or express yourself in a more comfortable sort: if my son were my husband, I should freelier rejoice in that absence wherein he won honour than in the embracements of his bed where he would show most love. When yet he was but tenderbodied and the only son of my womb, when youth with comeliness plucked all gaze his way, when for a day of kings entreaties a mother should not sell him an hour from her beholding, I, considering how honour would become such a person. that it was no better than picturelike to hang by the wall, if renown made it not stir, was pleased to let him seek danger where he was like to find fame. To a cruel war I sent him from whence he returned, his brows bound with oak. I tell thee, daughter, I sprang not more in joy at first hearing he was a manchild than now in first seeing he had proved himself a man.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: But had he died in the business, madam how then

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Then his good report should have been my son I therein would have found issue. Hear me profess sincerely: had I a dozen sons, each in my love alike and none less dear than thine and my good Marcius, I had rather had eleven die nobly for their country than one voluptuously surfeit out of action.
Enter a Gentlewoman

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Madam, the Lady Valeria is come to visit you.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Beseech you, give me leave to retire myself.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Indeed, you shall not. Methinks I hear hither your husbands drum, See him pluck Aufidius down by the hair, As children from a bear, the Volsces shunning him: Methinks I see him stamp thus, and call thus: Come on, you cowards! you were got in fear, Though you were born in Rome: his bloody brow With his maild hand then wiping, forth he goes, Like to a harvestman thats taskd to mow Or all or lose his hire.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: His bloody brow! O Jupiter, no blood!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Away, you fool! it more becomes a man Than gilt his trophy: the breasts of Hecuba, When she did suckle Hector, lookd not lovelier Than Hectors forehead when it spit forth blood At Grecian sword, contemning. Tell Valeria, We are fit to bid her welcome.
Exit Gentlewoman

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Heavens bless my lord from fell Aufidius!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Hell beat Aufidius head below his knee And tread upon his neck.
Enter VALERIA, with an Usher and Gentlewoman

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: My ladies both, good day to you.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Sweet madam.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: I am glad to see your ladyship.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: How do you both you are manifest housekeepers. What are you sewing here A fine spot, in good faith. How does your little son

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: I thank your ladyship well, good madam.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: He had rather see the swords, and hear a drum, than look upon his schoolmaster.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: O my word, the fathers son: Ill swear,tis a very pretty boy. O my troth, I looked upon him o Wednesday half an hour together: has such a confirmed countenance. I saw him run after a gilded butterfly: and when he caught it, he let it go again and after it again and over and over he comes, and again catched it again or whether his fall enraged him, or how twas, he did so set his teeth and tear it O, I warrant it, how he mammocked it!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: One on s fathers moods.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Indeed, la, tis a noble child.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: A crack, madam.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Come, lay aside your stitchery I must have you play the idle husewife with me this afternoon.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: No, good madam I will not out of doors.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Not out of doors!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: She shall, she shall.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Indeed, no, by your patience Ill not over the threshold till my lord return from the wars.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Fie, you confine yourself most unreasonably: come, you must go visit the good lady that lies in.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: I will wish her speedy strength, and visit her with my prayers but I cannot go thither.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Why, I pray you

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Tis not to save labour, nor that I want love.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: You would be another Penelope: yet, they say, all the yarn she spun in Ulysses absence did but fill Ithaca full of moths. Come I would your cambric were sensible as your finger, that you might leave pricking it for pity. Come, you shall go with us.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: No, good madam, pardon me indeed, I will not forth.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: In truth, la, go with me and Ill tell you excellent news of your husband.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: O, good madam, there can be none yet.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Verily, I do not jest with you there came news from him last night.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Indeed, madam

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: In earnest, its true I heard a senator speak it. Thus it is: the Volsces have an army forth against whom Cominius the general is gone, with one part of our Roman power: your lord and Titus Lartius are set down before their city Corioli they nothing doubt prevailing and to make it brief wars. This is true, on mine honour and so, I pray, go with us.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: Give me excuse, good madam I will obey you in every thing hereafter.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Let her alone, lady: as she is now, she will but disease our better mirth.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: In troth, I think she would. Fare you well, then. Come, good sweet lady. Prithee, Virgilia, turn thy solemness out o door. and go along with us.

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: No, at a word, madam indeed, I must not. I wish you much mirth.

lines.speaker: valeria
lines.text: Well, then, farewell.
Exeunt
